ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Family coming together
ygData.msgSnippet: I play with my younger brother who lives about 500 miles away.  It was fun starting as a Barbarian shaman and warrior team then we moved to a Wood Elf druid
ygData.messageBody:
I play with my younger brother who lives about 500 miles away. It was fun
starting as a Barbarian shaman and warrior team then we moved to a Wood
Elf druid and ranger team. I'm amazed even though I'm 10 yrs older how
much I have learned from him about gaming. He's hooked on WWII Online
lately, but thats okay since I need to level a bit to catchup with him
again :)


-mac


On Fri, 18 May 2001, Jackie wrote:

>
>
> Hi,
>
> I also play with family members....
>
> My son and his wife both play EQ... My hubby plays too, but not with me...
> LOL It's better that way... he has his friends and I have mine... We
> like it that way... We are together, but not together... We share the
> maps and EQ info... :)
>
>
> I imagine there are many, many family members playing EQ ....
>
> Cercie Kindheart ~~~ Cleric of Povar
>
> I have been playing EQ for about 2 months now and have been telling
> my sister all about the game. She has recently got a computer and
> bought EQ. So now we have started playing together. This is the first
> thing we have had in common in 20 years. A little weird to be killing
> orcs with your sister but cool. Respond if you like not looking for
> any though.
>
>
>
>
>
